qas.question: Octaves in linear pitch are what size?
Semitones in linear pitch are what size?
A440 in linear pitch are what size?
An equal-tempered semitone is subdivided into how many cents?
The pitch halfway between C (60) and C♯ (61) is labeled what?

context: This creates a linear pitch space in which octaves have size <a0_0>12<a0_0/>, semitones (the distance between adjacent keys on the piano keyboard) have size <a1_0>1<a1_0/>, and A440 is assigned the number <a2_0>69<a2_0/>. (See Frequencies of notes.) Distance in this space corresponds to musical intervals as understood by musicians. An equal-tempered semitone is subdivided into <a3_0>100<a3_0/> cents. The system is flexible enough to include "microtones" not found on standard piano keyboards. For example, the pitch halfway between C (60) and C♯ (61) can be labeled <a4_0>60.5<a4_0/>.
